Dr. Erwin is so enthusiastic about chemistry. He didn't collect the homework, but he gives a quiz with the exact problems the next day. You can probably get away without doing the homework and getting B's. Tests are very difficult and time constrained. Hardest part was finishing. He's always available and makes you feel welcome in his office.

For Credit: Yes
Attendance: Not Mandatory
Textbook: Yes
Tests are brutal. He doesn't have graded homework assignments, so if you aren't highly motivated to learn the material yourself you're in trouble. Can't recommend.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Erwin is a more tough professor. His tests can be difficult, but you do get to use your notes and book. He gives very good notes. His lectures can get pretty heated, but they can seem to drag on a little. Quizzes about every week over homework he assigns but isn't due. Sometimes he doesn't give a few quizzes near the end of the quarter.

For Credit: Yes
Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: No
Dr. Erwin teaches in a very clear cut manner. Homework most of the time follows examples taught directly in class, and tests follow problems on the homework. The tests are some what difficult, but if you pay attention in class (his voice is monotone, get some coffee) you'll do fine. He also allows open notes on the tests and final.

For Credit: Yes
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
Practically no partial credit on tests. Lectures like he teaches at a large university. Constantly yells. Expects the students to know the material before he teaches it.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: No
Dr Erwin doesn't do much teaching in class, he expects you to teach Yourself with the nightly reading and his tests, although they're open note, are pretty tough and take almost if not more than the given class time

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
Dr. Erwin gives excellent notes, and they can be used on tests and the final. Homework is optional, but he gives a quiz on it, usually with exact questions from the problem sets. His tests are long so you can't rely heavily on your notes if you want to finish the test. He also has help sessions before every test which are extremely helpful.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
Very Funny

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
"He's enthusiastic, but his tests are MISERABLE. It's incredibly frustrating to work through the homework with no problem, and to get counted off so much on quizzes and tests. Also, it's scary to answer a question, he tends to raise his voice a lot and often sounds condescending." I second this comment

Textbook: Yes
Very friendly and easy to talk to.

Textbook: Yes
I've had him for CHEM111-113. He's enthusiastic, but his tests are MISERABLE. It's incredibly frustrating to work through the homework with no problem, and to get counted off so much on quizzes and tests. Also, it's scary to answer a question, he tends to raise his voice a lot and often sounds condescending.

Textbook: Yes
Very difficult class. His tests are meant to challenge you. He tries to make it make sense, but only succeeds sometimes. He is very enthusiatic about teaching and will try to help you if you seek it. Overall, he is a good professor; he is just extremely challenging.

Erwin gives very nice notes to you in class, but flys through them. If you have questions, he's always available to help you, but he doesn't know how to explain things very well. He grades hard and his tests are meant to challenge you more than the hw and things covered in class. He also likes to yell when he talks. His class is boring.

Dr. Erwin is an amazing prof. He gives every opportunity to ask for help, including his home phone number. He really pays attention to how the class is doing and won't quiz over material unless a majority of the class gets it. In addition, his quizes are verbadum from the problem sets which he tells you up front.

He was loud and practically screamed at you during lectures. He gave you notes every class which was nice, but he could only explain things the way they were on your notes. If you had a question, he was hardly ever available to answer it and when he was, he did help very much.
I hated his class, he is not helpful at all.
He has a hard on for chemistry. Goes in depth too far sometimes and makes it hard to stay awake.

I think he's the best lower level chem prof there is. He's very loud (keeps you awake in class), knows what he's talking about, and hands out lots of excellent notes. He does tend to grade hard on labs and his tests are often long (open note however). Homework and Quizes are probably the low of this class with Erwin.
He's really energetic....but the tests.....
He is very good and helpful. His class was fun.
Definitely the best Chemistry teacher I've ever had. He's definitely energetic and entertaining. I really didn't like Chemistry till I had his class. He the best teacher I've had yet.
Great Prof...makes class very enjoyable and you walk out of there with a little bit more knowledge of Chem.
Definitely high output, an excellent teacher, you will NOT fall asleep in his class. Oh, and only about 3 write ups all quarter.

Having him the first period of the day is always an eye opener. His enthusiasm and character in the classroom makes a generally dull subject, in my mind, have some depth and character. As for the labs, the lack of write ups is awesome too
He has lots of files on him, and it is what helps you learn in this class. If you don't understand chemistry, he's very hard to learn from.

Very boring man. Staying awake is a real challenge in his class. His explanations could have been a little more clear. I couldn't stand his class because he didn't explain things very well. Don't think that I am writing this because I failed, I passed.
Best teacher I've had. assigns a lot of problem sets, but basically his tests are the sam format every year. (just get a file)
Great Professor and a funny guy. He can seem a little wierd at times though. He realy explains things well and ties previous concepts to the current concept.
Great guy, great teacher. Makes class fun and has a great sence of humor. He's always ready to answer a question, and isn't intimidating at all.
One of the best teachers I had.
Erwin is so cool, and you always know where he is b/c you can hear him laughing
all i can say is he has way to much energy at 8 am

For Credit: Yes
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes

He's good.
No Comments

gives lots of homework, but if you work hard he'll cut you some slack when grading
No Comments

Textbook: Yes

The only thing i didnt like was the hw took like 1-4hrs for like 20 problems and it was only worth 20 points

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: No

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes

Solid prof.

Textbook: Yes

Mottel seems to genuinely love Chemistry. He will do what he has to, even helping one on one in class, to help you understand. I was able to follow him very easily and would recommend him for anyone who isn't a chem major.

Very helpful outside of class. Flexible with due dates. Does a pretty good job explaining concepts. Tests didn't seem extremely hard, but I knew some stuff already from ES202. Class is usually a little quiet and boring, but can be interesting if you really pay attn. It worked for me in the afternoon, but I wouldn't recommend him for a morning prof.

He's a really nice guy who is genuinely concerned that you understand the material. He is willing to work with you one-on-one whenever the need arises. His homework is good at helping you understand the material, but his tests are on the hard side. Overall, pretty good experience.
he is money, you can turn it stuff extremely late and get full credit, he's very helpful just go see him and tests aren't bad if you run through his slides

This guy is very helpful. He will push you and push you to your absolute best on the questions in the lab manual. He is determined that you understand the material. We even set up our own little experiment together (ok, sounds weird), but it helped me learn more. If you are eager to learn, have him!

Get ready for a 3 hour prelab. Mottel insists on doing the entire lab for you in front of your eyes before he lets you into the lab. My advice...sit in the back and bring a book or something. And sneak out early! Boring as all get out.
He's really nice and always there for help. He won't let you go through the class without understanding the material.

Very fun class if you like chemistry at all. He enjoys the powerpoint a bit much, but it doesn't ever get too boring in his class. His class can be hard without much background in chemistry. Lots of homework, all easy. Tests are definately reasonable. I would definately take his class again.
Very easy to get a long with. He's always there to help you understand. He's an overall nice guy, but his tests can have a trick problem or two. Easy grader.

He seemed to make things very difficult. The tests were much harder than ever expected and he always worked problems MUCH easier than what he would ever give you. He's also a VERY touchy-feely type guy, so if you're not into that, avoid him at all costs!

This guy loves the powerpoint...yeah. If you are a woman, beware: he will stare at you during the lecture- he's a horny old guy. If you know chem before his class, you'll do well. If you don't find someone who does.
Nice guy, and tests are easy, HW nightly and the powerpoint got pretty boring. Lab was really easy

Burchett cannot write an assignment to save his life. They are all vague, especially when it comes to specifying what we need to turn in.You WON'T LEARN in his classes unless you teach yourself. But then why do you have a teacher?

Dr. Moore is a professor with a very unorthodox style of teaching. I enjoyed how Dr. Moore was more concerned with students learning how to be a good engineer than being able to do the problems in the book. He wasn't too bad, he'd probably have been better if the supporting material were better annotated, but I don't think we can blame that on him. If he does, as previous posts claimed, adjust test and quiz scores, I saw no evidence of it. A lot of fun, but those tests can kill you. Make sure you study all the support material before the exam.

The best prof I ever had while at Rose. Uses unique teaching methods, really nice and easy to talk to. His tests are usually really brutal but he purposely makes them that way and even if you get a low score, it's ok cause he almost always adjusts them at the end of the quarter.
Tests were hard and had low scores, but he adjusted the grades at the end to reflect this. Make sure you do the homework though.

She has a really good selection of books (they're mostly about sex) and the classes are fairly entertaining. She likes watching movies too.

Books or movies in this class can be very boring or really strange... (ie obsession with men stalking boys)... Furthermore, tests and quizes are unfair, even if you have read the books, you can still do poorly on the tests.

Attendance: Mandatory
I'm actually enjoying the class after not expecting to. I had heard bad things about Rhet-Comp in general, but this prof makes sure our discussions about the readings are very analytical and thought provoking. I like the type of readings she comes up with too. Not bad for a Rose HSS class!

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
I don't agree that she is all that easy. She expects a lot on papers, but I'll probably take another class or two with her. I think the so-called easiness is just her personality. She doesn't put anyone on the spot or try to make you feel stupid.

Intro to Film is a very easy class. All we do is watch 10 movies. They are actually decent movies too like The Godfather and Traffic. We write 1 paper and there are 2 essay test. She gives a hand out with 20 questions over the material covered and 4 of those questions are on the test.
This is a good teacher who knows her subject. She is helpful, clear, and above all cute.
This is a no-sweat course for an easy A. I highly recommend it when you have a quarter with a heavy load. Her mind seemed to be somewhere else but I gave her a HOT rating.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
This class is super easy. You really don't have to do any reading that's assigned because Dr. Dyer doesn't call on anyone and force them to talk in class. The essays aren't that bad either.

Her class is very easy, but there is a fair amount of work. You have to read an essay every night to discuss the next day in class. There are 4 papers, which you can write about whatever you want, as long as it is the required type, but she grades pretty hard on those. A B+ is very easy to get.

Extremely easy class. Every day there is a fairly short reading assigned. All you do in class is discuss the reading. Four papers to write the entire quarter, longest of which was 6-8 pages. Not to hard at all. However, getting an A is rediculously hard, but a B is easy to come by.

Easy teacher. She doesn't give many A's, usually for the best paper. Assigns HW, but it is really easy. Readings are also assigned, but are never used. I went to her on my last paper, and had her edit it and got a B+, i recommend doing that
The amount of work was just right.
too easy -- I had a better class in high school. Why do we have to take this course when nothing is taught. we only wrote 3 papers
Extremely easy teacher. She occasionally assigned readings from the book, but I never did, and it didn't matter that I didn't. I couldn't imagine this class being any easier.
she is the best teacher for rh 131. Best part is she is cool in class, not much homework, although she is rather strict in grading. The class doesn't become such a burden.
She knows very little about film, has no degree or formal training, and teaches entirely out of the book. Tests are essay based and hard unless you memorize the book, but there's no homework per se.
No Comments
Just have good grammar when writing papers, she grades grammar and punctuation, not personal ideas. No homework, just 3 papers every 2-3 weeks, then an oral presentation.
No Comments
She wants to see everyone get at least a 'C' but hates to give out the 'A'
very nice. class was fun. no homework.

Textbook: Yes
I think Dr. Clark did an excellent job teaching Anthropology of Religion. The entire class was discussion based and he always kept the discussion interesting. From time to time he would tell some crazy pointless story as well. Aside from (long) nightly readings, the only homework was in the form of essays, which he graded as I would expect in SV3XX
This is a blow course. I did not study at all and got a B. Highly recommended course when you are doing a senior project.
Did not do any reading(the only thing you do in this class) for this class and got a C
The class was sooo boring. I never went to class and I still did decent on the tests
He's funny and not too much homework.
i have had him for a few classes now, and as long as you do whats asked and no more, the worst you can get is a B.
Can be a little scatterbrained. He does best in discussion classes where you bring in the topics and he leads. Lots of fun when it is japan.
very difficult to follow never seemed prepared
grades by a portfolio, I don't think he ever read mine
doesn't teach, very little organization

Textbook: Yes
A good teacher. Tough at times, but he knows what he is doing and doesn't go so fast that students can't keep up. Also makes the language that we are learning relevant, not just straight book learning.

Textbook: Yes

He's not very flexible in his views, but that doesn't really matter unless you're not either. If you need an easy HSS VA, consider Dr. Michel. Has slight accent, but easy to understand. Loves subject. Hairstyle alert

Textbook: Yes

He's an awesome teacher and makes the topic interesting. Tests not too bad.
Nice guy and easy class. Doesn't expect more than what he teaches in class. Fun class.
Pretty nice guy. Not that hard, but you still learn. Takes time out of class to make sure people are learning the basics. Not a lot of assignments and easy tests.
He's a nice guy and does a great job of clairfying and of being understanding of turning in things a bit late.

Dr Michel is a great prof to have for german. I just know that he really cares about the class, and he's a really nice guy if you ever see him on campus. Test difficulty is average, and the homework is just for you to do to help you learn. Great Prof!

Textbook: No

He also directs the string ensemble, which is a blast to play in. Even if you're not a music buff like me, his class isn't hard for anyone with any sort of musical knowledge.

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes
I took music theory which is a decent class. You don't have to have any music backround to do well and he is very generous about grades. You also learn a lot about music and analyze a peice he has chosen. Be forewarned, it is mainly classical Mozart era stuff that he deals with.

quizzes almost every day. doesn't understand that this is an UNDERGRADUATE ENGINEERING college, not a graduate english major college. grades extreamly hard. also doesn't understand that "opinion" questions don't have wrong answers. avoid him like the plague.

i loved Dr. minster. His jokes were hilarious. And he came up with the best metaphor ever about relating school to a 50 year old **** with burn scars over all of her body.

I have no idea what the other ratings are talking about. I thought his class was slow and dull. He tries to be funny and entertaining. If you ask me I think he filled out some of those ratings. What engineer writes like that? I think the style of writing is more typical of a creative writing major.

He lets his personal opinions and interpretations interfere with grading. He loses sight that we are engineers and not english majors. In class he goes off on akward tangents. It is like he is in his own strange world.

I don't know about RH131, but he's certainly made the Bible interesting. This man is hilarious. His sense of humor reminds me of a low-key Conan O'Brien. Not too much work. A little reading every night and a paper a week. I haven't noticed any steep grading. B+ isn't hard to get. I highly recommend.

Dr. Minster is the only teacher I've ever had that made an english class enjoyable. He is an amazingly funny, smart, and witty guy. I strongly encourage taking a Minster class because for 50 minutes a day, 4 days a week, you'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll learn and you'll have fun doing it.

Brilliant guy. One of the best instructors I've ever had. Funny as hell. Tough grader but oh so worth every purple mark on your papers. If you take his class (and you should!), ask him about Gary Snyder and William Blake sometime...

He runs one of the hardest classes you can imagine. His grading is realllly steep. Good Work = C grade. Not to mention TONS of homework. Not much really gets done in class, however he is a fun and a nice guy and this class was much harder than all the other English classes.

Mister is a cool guy, but he is a tough grader. If you're not willing to go the extra mile, he is definitely not for you. But if you want to have a good time and learn something, I say go for it. He'll even hang out and chat during office hours.
Stud. Hilarious as hell, good guy - his homework assignments are funnier than just about anything, too.
Funny guy. HW assignments and grading of rough drafts were pretty helpful. Tough on grading, but lenient on due dates. If a few people asked for an extension on a paper, he'd give it to us.
Dr. Minster is a pretty helpful guy, that is easy to get along with. He does grade a litle steep, but he always tells you how to make your work better.
He is a very funny man. Besides that his class is pretty difficult. He told us that he believes an A is almost not possible, because an A would be perfection.

If you are not an english major or once thought about being one, you will find this class extremely hard. He is slightly helpful, but his grading is still really bad. He also contradicts himself making it hard to decipher what he is talking about.

He was very funny and extremely helpful. He was tough grading the papers but had lots of stuff to help you boost it up. Besides the papers everything else seemed to be a finish it with some effort and you wil do well. I definitely recommend him.

He is a great guy and loves what he does...knows his stuff too. His class was very hard and a lot of work, but fun and there were very good discussions. He will work with you on deadlines and help get you started on papers if you are having trouble.

He's funny and he talks a lot, but if you really like talking about what you're studying, it's really really awesome. He's nice and his grading is mostly based on how hard you tried- if you didn't, your grade will reflect that. The only problem is that you need to READ your homework, not just listen for it. Fairly understanding if you forget though

Textbook: Yes
All I can say is avoid taking his classes if at all possible. Every assignment is incredibly obscure, he speaks in riddles, and his emailS (which there is never just one as he never checks them before sending them out) are miserably long. He turns a potentially interesting topic like World History into a "wait, what's going on?" kind of class. BAD.

Attendance: Mandatory
Textbook: Yes
TONS of reading. He assigns a chapter (25 plus) pages a night and in class he goes over maybe one page of what you read. Textbooks are extremely expensive in all of his classes. He assigns homework and does not tell you what he wants to see on the homework (no rubrics) and then grades very unreasonably. Avoid if possible.

Textbook: No
Martland loves talking, and is very intelligent. One could easily get an A and not go to class because most of the work in class is discussion. Tough grader but makes you learn from your mistakes. A little effort can easily get you an A

Textbook: Yes
Martland is a boss. Easy class. Papers are hard. But everything else is easy. Enjoy if you get him. He's really smart. Pleasure to be in his class, would repeat again. He made a content as boring as colonial latin america a fun experience

Textbook: Yes
Truth of the story is, I suck at map quizzes. That alone was making me get a D by midterm. He grades papers based on historical accuracy. I don't write well that way. He might be for you if you're; used to droning lectures, good at writing historically accurate papers, good at remembering dates and names, and like reading < 20 pgs. a night for hw.

Textbook: Yes
Knows his stuff but very boring lectures over a very boring topic, so it was hard to care and pay attention. I dozed through every class and still got a decent grade. Reading involved, but he covers most of it in class.

Textbook: No
Really interested in what he was teaching. Easy Class.

Textbook: No
I barely read, listened in class and got B's on the tests. I worked hard on the papers and got A's. Ended up with a B+. Pretty subjective grader, but I was able to get on his good side. I liked him as a prof though.

Textbook: No
Didn't read text, only listened in class. Got high B's on tests.

Textbook: Yes
easy

Textbook: Yes
I hate Colonial Latin America! He grades way too hard, and he thinks that people actually care about his class. Get used to having a midterm, pretty regular homework, and lots of boring studying. If you don't study you will get a really grade. He is kind of a jerk.
Very smart guy!
complete liar, and ****. wont help at all. Way to much reading think that his class is your main focus. Wont take him unless you want a hard time and be very bored

Yeah there's definately a ton of boring reading. Don't really have to do most of it though as there's not many quizzes. Grades semi-hard. A few papers but no tests so that's OK. Explains stuff pretty well.

Well, all I have to say is that there's lots of reading every night. It's manageable, but really annoying. If you want a life, don't take this class. If you don't want a life, then have at it. The material's pretty easy to understand though, which is always a plus.
One of the easiest graders ever. Very helpful outside of class. Little work to do in the class for credit.
Dr Martland is one of the best. Very easy to understand. He also realizes that he's at an engineering school, so he knows what he's up against ;) A very good prof, I would recomend him to anyone.
Great prof. Lectures very well, and understands that he's at an engineering school.
Martland's class was really easy, and most of it was because of how good of a job he did explaining everything. The lectures are so what long, but Martland does his best to make them enjoyable.
Western Civ with Dr. Martland was awesome. He's a great guy and very approachable. You can also learn a lot even though it is very boring at times. I really liked it..

Textbook: Yes
He's really enthused about teaching. Class will always be fun and keep you interested. The reading is a little heavy, but it pays off when having an enthralling conversation. I'd definitely choose him again.

Textbook: No
Totally useless class, biggest waste of money at Rose. Paid $60 for a 6 digit number for an online text w/ a ton of errors, read more than do anything productive, and learned the useful things (like resumes) in high school. House grades hard, assigns 1/3 of the book a night, and help, well you can ask, not like it's useful. Never take his class!
AHHHH!!! Way too much to read. I spent more time reading for his class than I did on homework for three other classes. He grades papers very hard. Great for in class discussion.

Quoting The Girl Next Door, "This guy's the****". Really he's an awesome prof. Easy to get a "B" with average effort. Does a lot of class discussion. I am in my first class with him and i'm taking him again in the fall. He's just a really cool guy that would be fun to hang out with outside of school. The A's tough, but House is a ****

House was very helpful and his quizzes were easy if you read the material. He got the class involved in his lectures, so he never just stood up in front of the class the whole time. The books we read were interesting and there was only one that wasn't enjoyable. His reaing assignments can be kind of long, but it's worth it.
AMAZING PROF. His lectures are so entertaining, and his grading is relatively easy. I hateed english but loved his class. Take him if you can.
Dr. House is really entertaining in class, so he makes you want to learn the material so you can participate in his always amusing lectures. He's really good at getting to know his students, as well.
He's a good professor, and that's the bottom line. He grades relatively hard, but it's fair, and it his grading actually makes you a better writer.
Did an awesome job making a boring required class interesting and worthwhile. Always willing to help if asked, great at explaining things.
Lots of BS, I don't know why I show up to class.
Too heavy of a work load!!
Great class, Great teacher,really makes the material interesting. I learnd more in this class than in any other I have ever taken. Not a bad workload either.
i would definitely reccomend him, unless you have little to no brain power and/or are intimidated by people with said brain power. he's cool to talk to too.
didn't cover writing -- just reading that interested him
Stupid reading -- stupid class -- stupid teacher. Avoid him at all cost.
Good teacher, made class interesting even though i don't enjoy humanities.

A real nice guy. Pretty cool. Classes were generally interesting; he likes debates and group activities. Though, if you ever like to be glib or quirky in your writing, tone it down some. He likes his Shakespeare papers pretty serious.
If you can get House for Tech Comm, take him. It'll be an easy A, especially if you can BS a couple papers really well. Great guy too.

For Credit: Yes

I enjoy math, but his class is a world of hurt. Lectures are directly from the book.

Textbook: No
The worst professor I've had in my two years at Rose. He can't explain concepts to save his life, he rambles on and on, and he was very poor at addressing questions students had in class. Avoid at ALL COSTS.

Textbook: Yes
Rotten Broughton. A nick name I found to be very true. His lectures are very hard to follow, I was lucky I had a decent understanding of this material or I'd be in trouble. He gave us a huge quiz over derivs and didn't give partial credit for work shown, so if you missed one part you missed the whole question. AVIOD BROUGHTON!

Textbook: Yes
He really gets into his lectures.

I had him for Disco II. He probably makes 4 to 5 mistakes daily on the board, and students have to point them out. He is very unsure of himself, and he doesn't actually teach. If you read the book, you'll learn much more than if you listen to him. I got the lowest grade on his tests that I've ever gotten in my entire life. Avoid him if you can.

Worthless. I learned almost nothing while in his class. He wastes time by showing off what he has done in Maple, but when something goes wrong with his script, he falls apart. His tests are increadibly easy. If you are a good self learner, he might be a good option. Otherwise, avoid. NOT recomended.

Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Dr. Broughton would be a great teacher if you already knew all the material he was teaching you and the purpose of the class was to unlearn it. I come in to class some days and wonder if he kept teaching after we left the previous day.
He is a terrible prof. His tests are hard and you don't learn much. The worst part is he is very comfortable with failing people. I would not suggest taking his class.

This guy really pulled a 180. Last year i had him and i thought he was a jerk off. This year, he seems to have found a sence of humor, and i actually dont mind going to class. Despite all the past ratings, hes a good prof to take.

Difficult mainly because he is the dept. chair. Dr. Broughton is incredibly smart, and he is willing to correct mistakes he has made in stupid places like boardwork. Study up for tests, and make sure you're just not pressed for time: long tests!

Terrible. He makes a ton of mistakes during class and makes simple things complicated. Except to apply tangent and normal lines to every concept learned. Grading policy sucks--homework is graded on correctness with all even problems, and tests don't relate to the material.
Terrible. Didnt know what he was doing half the time
he taught us stuff that we didnt even really need to know. He said it was for our own knowledge. What kind of prof talks about stuff we dont even need to know. He sucks.
This guy is horrible. It is almost impossible to get full credit on an assignment. His lectures are very unclear and make even the easiest of concepts seem impossible.
This guy is awful-his grading is terrible and he makes you feel like you know nothing-AVOID!
Holy heck...he is the worst teacher I've had...ever. If I had known what his class was like I would have dropped it like a hot potato.
he is the worst teacher out there. do every thing to prevent taking his class.

His grading is the worst I've ever heard of. First he grades on the right answer, if you dont have the right answer, you get no credit. Next he grades your methods, if you dont use his methods and his notation for everything you get no credit.
He is the worst teacher i have ever had in my entire life, and i have had a lot of teachers.
This guy will make the things you all ready know sound confusing. Take him and you will be reading your book.
He can't teach the material.

Textbook: Yes
Good Professor! He is very informative and will try to explain how to do things in the easiest fashion. Doesn't like the book too much. He is very smart, but doesn't explain things as much as needed occasionally. I was decently prepared for the final. He doesn't assign too much homework. Overall, one of the better math teachers!

fun guy, though sometimes operates under the false impression that people get what he's talking about...

his tests are impossible and his quizes are hard but he usually has retakes for them. easiest home work grade ill ever have, really smart and will go over things many times if you show you dont understand but mostly imposibly hard grader. good teacher.

Okay, I have to admit he does give help to students. However, he usually assumes everyone has taken a whole year of calculus before coming to Rose. As a result, the pace he teaches is SUPER FAST!!! Quizzes & Tests are impossible to finish within the time limit he gives too.
Great teacher, couldnt ask for much more from him.
Lautzenheiser tells students just enough to point them in the right direction, then will answer questions if they get stuck. He makes it intersting and keeps students awake.
Lautzy is money, he's tons of help and you can tell he really loves what he's teaching about. He is always so excited that he kept me awake and interested in his lectures
He seems to absolutly love the subject and keeps it interesting with his quirky sense of humor. I wish I could have him for all my math classes
Good prof, extremely excited over math. You'll do well if you pay attention to his lectures... but they get on your nerves a bit.

He really explained Calc 3 very well, and by the exams I understood each topic perfectly with no outside effort. His teaching of vectors was amazing, although he tended to get a bit too excited over them...

I wish I had him for all of my math classes!! He is terrific!! He is clear, enthusiastic and very helpful. His tests, quizzes, and assignments are not too difficult if you pay attention. He prepares you very well for everything!!

Even though he says some odd stuff, he does genuinely care about his students and I enjoy stopping in his office occasionally. I would recommend both FTC and him.

For Credit: Yes

This man really cares about his students and has done so for a long time. Would definitely recommend him for Fast Track Calculus and any other math class.

For Credit: Yes

very bad for DE2 doesn't quite know how to tell you the material that will be on exams.

For Credit: Yes

Great guy and an amazing teacher. One of the best math teachers ive had. Explains things multiple different ways to make sure you understand. Take this man's class if you are able to, you WILL NOT REGRET IT.

For Credit: Yes
Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
He's a nice guy. Homework is very long at first but it gets much more reasonable. Always there before first period if you have questions. Friendly, although sometimes acts frustrated (it's really just excitement!). No partial credit on quizzes and most tests so be very careful with your work. Lets you redo any HW, which is great.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Dr. Graves was an awesome professor. I had him for calculus 2 and loved it. He is always there to help and his lectures were always related to test material. Go to his review sessions before each test because he will go over everything that will be on the test. If you do your homework and actually try in this course, you will get an easy A.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Passionate about the students and the subject. He works hard to ensure students understand the topic, so most students leave with a good grade as well as an understanding of the subject. However, he works at his own pace; there was a bit of material on the final that we did not cover in class.

For Credit: Yes
Attendance: Mandatory
Grade: 
Textbook: No
Sometimes he seems kinda crazy and goes off on strange tangents. Very good professor though, makes things clear. Grades tests very strictly, but he is usually clear before hand for what small things he will take big points off for.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
Professor Graves is straight forward and teaches material in a way that can be easily understood. Lets students know what topics will be covered on tests and is extremely accommodating if you have any conflicts need extra time. Took him for MA 102 and MA 113. Number one in the math department by far!

Textbook: Yes
He is an amazing professor, by far the best teacher I've ever had. Had him for fast track and DE1.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is pretty much my hero. I had him for Fast Track and for DE1. He always explained well in class, and while his assignments (for DE1) were daily, they would be only about an hour of work. His tests were easy if you did the homework. The only thing: be prepared to spend an hour talking to him if you go to his office hours.

Textbook: Yes
He is a good professor, he does mistakes as any human bean. However, that is OK and fixable. For me it was a little bit difficult to flow his writing on the board. He hands notes but I never used them, I preferred taking my own notes. If you have any difficulty he would be very helpful. I really recommend him.

Textbook: No
makes too many horrible mistakes, avoid him if you cares about your future math ability, otherwise go for him for your GPA

Textbook: Yes
Absolutely fantastic. Told funny stories that either pertained to the material or were completely random, but always fun overall. If something wasn't clear he would keep explaining until we got it. Definitely cares about his students. The tests weren't too bad and the nightly hw was a good way to learn the material well.

Textbook: Yes
He is good in every way. Graves makes class fun and tests are easy. He teaches class very well.

Textbook: No
"Silly rabbit, you're not a snake" he taught me for fast track calculus, and he was so spirited about it that we coulsn't help but get wxcited with hm

Textbook: Yes
He's the best math teacher I've ever had. Hilarious. I love his class.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is awesome. He is hilarious in class and he teaches really well. he makes sure that EVERYONE understands whatever he is saying, so sometimes you move slowly, but it's not a problem. take him if you can the homework load isn't too bad (short assignments each night) and the tests are straight forward.

Textbook: No
One of the easier math professors at Rose. I don't think his lectures are very good, but you cant help but like the guy anyways. I'm not a major so when I needed to take match courses I tried to get them with him just to get some easy A or B.

Textbook: Yes
He's an OK teacher but not as good as some of the other comments would indicate. He makes lots of mistakes. He's alot like a high school teacher he assigns homework daily and doesn't even have a PhD! OK, but there are better options.

Textbook: Yes
Awesome prof. Very easy to understand, always willing to re-explain or help. Lots of homework, due every day, but definitely helped understand the material. He used MAPLE a lot, which I liked. 10th week he spent going over old finals problems, I was definitely prepared for the final, aced it. His tests aren't too bad, some 'challenge' problems.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is money if you don't know the material well. Hefty homework load 4 assignments a week w/2-10 problems which are worth as much as the final. Clear explanations, though it does get a little absurd when he asks "Any questions?" about stuff you should have learned already, like simple algebra

Textbook: Yes
One of the best math teachers.

Textbook: Yes
Explained everything clearly. Maple was used every class.

Textbook: Yes
Amazing prof. Graves is a really nice professor and always willing to help. Difficult to understand sometimes, but if you ask him again he'll clairfy everything. Gives a fair amount of homework, but it helps a lot for the tests and helps you to understand it. I also had him for FTC.

Textbook: Yes
Graves is an awesome guy. He really provides alot of clarity and will always be glad to go back and explain things. He presents things in different ways from the books, but he does give a lot of book work. However you learn the material and you can decide if you even want the homework to count toward your grade at the end of the quarter.
I heard stuff sayin Graves was the man. I strongly disagree. He gives out like 10 problems a night and they're TOUGH. Dont take him and just like the math department here, it sucks

Lectures are really good and interesting. Gives a ton of homework, but you definitely learn the material. He also lets you redo the homework for full credit, but he doesn't accept any late work at all. Probably one of the better math profs at Rose.
He gives reasonable tests, is in his office always willing to help, and keeps the class entertained constantly even when it's 8 in the morning and you want to die.
Tons of homework, but that's how you learn. Right now... we're talking about 2 hours a night - but he's a really good teacher, and I really feel like I know the material.
Prof Graves was cool. Always was very explicit on what was going to be on tests and quizes. Sometimes he would give us some of the questions before a test. But homework is due every day.

Dr. Graves is Soooo funny! I had calc at 9:00 and he definitely kept us awake....tried to explain u-substitution integrals by relating them to snakes and bunnies...Lets you redo homework for full credit. He takes a geniune interest in your success...

Great teacher. Teaches the material well. Gives a ton of hw, but if you keep up with it, you will do well on tests and final. Little goofy, but he keeps you entertained. Try to get him if you can...one of the best math profs Rose has.

Good prof. Fairly easy, really enjoys what he does. I was a bit left in the dark on parts of the final, but I still ended up doing pretty well. Do your homework because he gives you some nice options with it.

He made the class very fun and interesting. He gave a lot of homework, but in the end it really helped. He gave partial credit and his tests/quizzes were not too hard. He prepared the class well for all assignments and exams.
Cool guy, and tests arent bad. HW every night and its a****load of problems. Helpful, and kind of weird in a cool way
He does a good job making the math simple and teaching the theory; however, it's difficult to pay attention to him. He's nice guy and makes crazy sounds during class. It's great!
Pretty easy, but he still teaches the material. Looks like Steve Martin.
Nice guy. The class seemed to go at a slow pace. His class was fairly easy and the lectures were decent.
Hard with partial credit, decent understanding of the material.
impressed with how much this prof is willing to help. office door is always open, also entertaining in class.
Doesn't know how to write fair tests of the subject matter. Doesn't give ample partial credit.
No Comments
friendly (a bit too friendly to the girls), easy grader, didn't teach many concepts though
Awesome teacher, makes everything seem simple.

Dr. Evans is energetic but I don't think she is very good at teaching. She doesn't explain stuff very well, and has way to many conceptual questions on tests. Its a math class that has 30% of points multiple choice or true false. Plus, questions are hard to follow.

Textbook: Yes
She is probably my favorite teacher I had here at RHIT. She was always super helpful and made it her passion to make sure all of her students learned something new in class. She also made learning fun. I strongly recommend her.

great teacher. i had her for 8 am stats and she woke me up everyday. she's all over the place and says awkward things that are completely hilarious! if you have the chance to take her for stats, take her! you will not regret it. She is such a fun prof! At times she would go off on these tangents that didn't really make much sense, but she was very concerned that we all understood the material and had fun doing so. Great prof, take her if you can!
Awesome professor. Her class was interesting, and I learned a lot without having to kill myself. Best experience at Rose!

Love to see previous poster's Psychology degree -- that is how he/she was able to give the A.D.D. diagnosis, right? HA! Dr. Evans IS VERY enthusiastic about teaching! If making sure that each & every student totally understands concepts before moving on makes her easy, well she must be guilty! I'd highly recommend any class with Dr. Evans!

Easiest class I've ever taken at rose. At the same time, a class I'll use in a real job or world and I didn't learn anything at all... You need to look past her A.D.D. to actually get something out of her...

Very enthusiastic, and understanding of the typical college student. Homework sets were cake, and passes out a lot of notes. Sometimes the lack of interst in the topic caused me to stop paying attention, but that is my own fault, as she kept on explaining everything. Would highly recommend taking her class

Hyper as anyone I've ever seen, but that just means she's enthusiastic about this subject. Her tests are easy, her homework is cake, and she is as helpful as they come. You have to be a total slapdick not to do well in this class. Just remember to study for your tests, or you could get screwed.
She's a great teacher. You'll learn the material and get a good grade at the same time.
Best math prof I've had so far. Excited about the material and very willing to help. Tests are a good measurement of what you know.

Dr. Evans ROCKS! She worked really hard to help everyone across the board. She gets way to fired up! Too much sugar free chocolate pudding! She made simple boring things fun and exciting - best prof a Rose hands down!
One of the best professors at Rose! Really understanding to students' needs. She's available for help outside of class and even answers email questions late at night.
Evans is great, and she's hot!
hilarious
One of the nicest (and hottest) professors here at this institute. She is hilarious
Awesome prof! Always available for extra help...very easy going. One of my fav profs!
class was easy, but prof was always enthusiastic & very flexible with scheduling
No Comments

Prof. Evans is one of the best at Rose. She made sure everyone “got” the material. She was always willing to stay after class or schedule a time to meet with her if there were any questions. She always asked our opinion on matters and did an all around

Boring lectures. Tests are pretty easy, but takes off for poor grammer on the "explain" parts.

He is very clear with what he teaches, and if you don't get something, he'll keep explaining it until you do. Projects are simple, yet reinforce the topic they cover, and are very easy to complete.
Great guy, I'm sittin in his class right now. Tests are easy if you do the review. Homework is due every Thursday and is more than doable...Projects aren't demanding either. Highly recommended prof.

He is the most inconsistent teacher at Rose. He have boring lectures and changes the way he does them all the time. He also seems very unhappy as a prof. He is very helpful and lienent if you don't have time to get your homework done. His tests are easy, but you are pushed for time. I am not sure how prepared I am going to be for the final.

Really wants to help you out. He spent hour after hour teaching me in his office about everything. His lectures are weak and disorganized. He seems so unorganized. Don't plan on getting any homework back, ever. Also, he is very judgemental. I won't take his class again.

He seems to have changed. He is not very helpful. He accuses a lot. Grades papers unfairly. Very unorganized. I don't know what happened to him. I had him for Calc II and loved him. Right now he really sucks as a teacher.

He goes really fast in class and assigns practice problems ever night. However, he rarely collects homework and always goes over the homework from the night before. If you are not quick at picking up math probably don't take this course with him.

Dr. Rickert is a genius. I was blown away sometimes by his pure talent and intellect. He was always patient with us and willing to explain things to us, no matter how long it took (he put off the next day's homework more than once because we didn't understand the material entirely yet). His tests were hard, but other than that I loved the class.

He does not give any lectures. He gives you homework, expects you to understand it, and if you dont he will go over the homework. You basically have to already understand most of the material to do well. Not horrible but not great either.

He moved way too fast for me. I took the entire class, but I feel that i only learned the material for the tests. I think is method of teaching does not work at all. He gives homework and then goes over it the next day. If you don't already have a backgroudn in calc like me, then it is gonna be rough.

He moves quickly and expects you to get it all. His exams require you to use what you learned to do things you haven't learned; however, he is very nice and will help you out. He never sleeps, and he is always on aim if you need help.
This guy knows his stuff. Great professor if you can keep up.

Even considering that they're curved, I actually thought the tests were easier than some of the other ones I've had!! It wasn't that hard for me, except maybe the final, and I thought he was really understanding.

Rickert's a genius, but goes through stuff very quickly, and it's hard to keep up. Tests are insanely hard to do well on, and you'll never actually finish them. Homework takes quite a while. Don't be afraid to switch teachers if he's too much for you.

This guy is the man! I learned an incredible amount in this class and greatly increased my math skills. Ricket was incredible, would definately take again. It wasn't easy, but the learning experience was the best I've ever had. (And that's saying a lot!)

Had to drop the course. Rickert is obviously extremely smart, but he moves way to fast. Homework takes several hours a night, minimum. Luckily, they're only worth 10% of your grade. Tests are long and difficult. I wouldn't take him again if you paid me.
Smart, but very difficult. Lengthy homework that sometimes requires an unmentioned "trick" to solve reasonably. Tests are monstrous.
Very hard tests, very intelligent, knows his stuff, but doesn't get it across very well at times
Feels it is his job to make students feel as stupid as possible. Not a nice person.

good teacher, really good at explaining material. Tests are extremely hard (don't plan on finishing) but he curves the tests and then does a final curve at the end of the class as well. an A was an 80% for my section)
Exams are too difficult. They don't cover what you learn in the class. Very unapproachable guy. Makes you feel dumb.

one of the best profs at rose
dull, gives a lot of quizzes but not a hard grader

Great prof. Gives tons of partial credit, doesn't collect homework but has a quiz everyday over the day before (usually the homework of the day before exactly) You can email him at 3 am and he will go over you quetion that day. Loves when ppl have ?'s, if you have him don't be afraid to ask!

Now that I have taken PH112 with another teacher, I can really understand how great a teacher Dr. Moloney was. He does not even collect homework, and there are daily easy quizzes on the stuff he covered the day before. He grades fairly on tests.
Great dude. Keeps class focused. He's a human calculator. No homework is collected and quizzes are easy if ya have any idea of what you're doing. Highly recommend this fella.

great prof

However, he is very helpful during the lab times, and grants extensions if you have trouble. Only gives two days to do his labs, along with making you write more than any other Rose prof.

Ditteon is a great guy. If you need an extension on your lab, he will give it to you as long as you don't ask for it a day after it was due. Great guy, hard grader.

while he demands a lot, he takes points off for everything, even things he doesn't ask for. He grades way too hard. Expect a low B/high C on most labs no matter if you do it perfect or not. If you care about grades-DO NOT TAKE. he also makes you right out procedure while doing lab.. takes forever

Ditteon's lab class was fine. He demands a lot, but as long as you follow his directions, it's easy to get a good lab grade. You also learn more than you would in other labs. I bet he'd be good for class, too.

Although he is one of the top ten hardest professors here at Rose, after taking his lab course, you will be well prepared for others. He explained things well, and was very clear on what he wanted. Enjoyed listening to the Classic Rock he plays in lab.
hardest lab professor, but after you have him for lab you will always get A's on your labs.

He was a horrible teacher. He read off of hi paper to put notes on the board. He screwed up every other day. I doubt he even knew how to do half of the problems he assigned to the class for homework off the top of his head.

Definately my favorite teacher here so far. He does so many examples of problems and shows how the iterations of equations come about. Tests are difficult, but prepare you for the final exam. I learned how to think in this class.
Hardest tests ever!

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes

For Credit: Yes
Grade: 
Textbook: Yes
Dr. Duree is the best. He's one of the few teachers I've ever had who understand the point of education, that school shouldn't be just about getting a certain grade by any means necessary. He wants you to learn the material. That being said, he will be very flexible and extend deadlines as far as he can if you need extra time to understand.

For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes

He also lets you drop your lowest test grade. Dr. Duree also takes a TON of time in lectures to go over fundamental ideas (get ready to hear Fma repeated over and over again).

Attendance: Mandatory

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes
The best professor i ever saw in my life.

Textbook: Yes
Best teacher at Rose-Hulman. Truly cares about the students and their success. Put forth effort and show that you care--you will be rewarded. Do anything in your power to get Duree as your physics professor and you will not regret it. Tests are somewhat difficult but he grades pretty easy. Like I said, show initiative, ask questions.

Textbook: Yes

Textbook: Yes
Duree is an amazing professor. He explains everything very clearly and I highly recommend him. He lets you choose whether you want to use mastering physics or just do homework by hand. He is extremely lenient with partial credit.

Textbook: Yes
Amazing professor. If only I had someone like him in high school. He knows his stuff very well and very rarely makes a mistake. Take his class if you can!

Textbook: Yes
Awesome professor. His tests are old final exam problems, and examples he has shown in class. Gives full credit for just showing how you would calculate answers, not punching numbers into calculator. With that being said, write down your units! Explains concepts well, will take for 112,113. Oh BTW, dont take for lab...doesn't follow manual.

Textbook: Yes
Best Professor at Rose-Hulman hands down. I had him for Physics 1, 2, and 3 and he was awesome. Along with being extremely helpful, his tests aren't anything he doesn't prepare you for. He knows me by name and asks how things are going on a daily basis. TAKE IF YOU HAVE THE CHANCE!!!!!

Textbook: Yes
Duree gives very clear notes and teaches slowly enough that you can take time to understand the information and still take notes. He also teaches every small detail, assuming you have no prior knowledge in the subject. He also loves to give partial credit for problems and is available and willing to help outside class. I HIGHLY recommend him.

good prof who is willing to help with anything. Only complaint is that he is a very picky grader. Very easy to receive partial credit for any answer but very hard to get full credit.

Textbook: No
write down what he says before each lab b/c he doesn't follow the manual

he's a very easy teacher. his tests are pretty easy, he explains things very well, his class overall isnt too hard. he is an excellent teacher and explains things VERY WELL. if you have the chance ALWAYS TRY TO GET HIM!

Solid professor. Easy-to-understand lectures. Reasonable amount of homework. About 10% EC, so build that grade pad. 1-2 quizzes per week drawn straight from the homework. Tests are hard; he says he makes them difficult so that the department-wide final would seem easy, which it did. If you work quickly, you'll be fine.

https://www.ratemyprofessors.com/profess.comment:
For Credit: Yes
Textbook: Yes
In class,Dr. Popovic is a good professor. His classes require effort, but he is always ready to help students. As a lab instructor, he has very high expectations for lab journals and can be a tough grader. However, he outlines his criteria in a straightforward matter ,so you can understand what he expects.
